intro: Allosorus hottentottus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers are usually pink, purple, or white, and they bloom in spring and summer. Allosorus hottentottus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
